STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 26, 2020
Alison Morrison
Shiawassee County DHHS
1720 E Main St
Owosso, MI 48867
RE: License #: CP780201406
Shiawassee County DHHS
1720 E Main St
Owosso, MI 48867
Dear Ms. Morrison:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
(date). Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be
noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the MSA
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of approval
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Venus M. Decker, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(248) 639-9585
enclosure
2

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT

LicenseLicense #: CP780201406
Licensee Name: Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services

Lansing, MI 48902

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by
another agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record
containing all of the following documents:
(a) Prior approval from the certifying agency authorizing
the placement of a child in the home.
(b) Documentation that the foster parent is willing to accept
the foster child.
(f) Documentation that the foster parent has received
orientation to the policies of the borrowing agency.
(g) A copy of the foster parent /agency agreement signed
by the foster parent and the borrowing agency.
Three borrowed beds were reviewed. One out of thee borrowed
beds did not have the above information documented in the file
prior to placement. The child was placed on 10/15/22 and the
documentation was dated 10/22/20.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(1) An agency shall do all of the following when anyone in
the agency receives information that relates to possible
noncompliance with any foster home rule:
(a) Submit a special investigation record to the
department's licensing authority within 5 working days in
the manner prescribed by the department.
Two special evaluations were reviewed. One out of two
evaluations did not have an investigation record, DCWL-259
completed within 5 working days. The intake was 7/31/20 and
the DCWL-259 was sent on 8/22/20.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(1) An agency shall do all of the following when anyone in
the agency receives information that relates to possible
noncompliance with any foster home rule:
4

(c) Conduct a thorough investigation including all
necessary collateral contacts.
Two special evaluations were reviewed. One out of two was not
conducted thoroughly. After the interviews with the children
were conducted, there was information that alleged the foster
parents yelling at the children. This was also noted in the
renewal. This information was not followed up on in the
investigation.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(3) The agency shall document all of the following in the
child's record before a change of placement occurs:
(e) Replacement preparation, regardless of the child's
age, appropriate to the child's capacity to understand,
which includes an explanation to all relevant parties as to
why the change is necessary.
Three foster care files were reviewed. One out of three files did
not have replacement preparation completed in MiSACWIS.
REPEAT VIOLATION-2019 INTERIM
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(3) The agency shall document all of the following in the
child's record before a change of placement occurs:
(g) Information about the child was shared with the new
placement, consistent with the requirements of R
400.12417.
Three foster care files were reviewed. Two out of three files did
not have documentation that the new placement was shared the
requirements of R 400.12417. A DHHS 3307 is used by this
agency to document rule compliance. One child was placed on
3/13/20 but a DHHS 3307 was not completed until 9/20. The
second child was placed on 2/12/20 and the DHHS 3307 was
not completed until 10/20.
REPEAT VIOLATION-2019 AND 2018
5

R 400.12420 Updated service plans.
(1) An updated service plan, as required in R
400.12418(2)(b), shall include all of the following
information:
(b) Confirmation that the child's current foster home
continues to appropriately meet the placement needs of the
child.
Three foster care files were reviewed. One out of three did not
have confirmation that the child’s new placement meets the
needs of the child.
R 400.12420 Updated service plans.
(1) An updated service plan, as required in R
400.12418(2)(b), shall include all of the following
information:
(e) A plan which includes any changes made since the
previous plan and which has the content specified in R
400.12419.
Three foster care files were reviewed. One out of three did not
discuss the changes of the new plan in the treatment plan.
Goals of a child changed from a need to a strength without the
reasoning for that change.
REPEAT VIOLATION-INTERIM 2019
6

R 400.12503 Policy and procedures.
(3) An agency shall provide a youth in independent living
with a copy of the agency’s policies and procedures
required by this rule.
Three independent living records were reviewed. Two out of
three did not have documentation or verification that the youth
received all the policies and procedures.
R 400.12505 Supervision.
(2) An agency shall provide the following minimum
supervision:
(b) At monthly intervals, ensure that the youth is
complying with the terms of the contract required by R
400.125010, continues to reside in a safe and acceptable
environment, and is managing expenditures.
Three independent living records were reviewed. One out of
three records did not have a monthly budget describing the
management of expenditures.
R 400.12504 Eligibility requirements
(2) All of the following shall be in the case record before a
youth is placed in independent living:
(a) How the youth meets the eligibility requirements for the
specific program the youth is being placed into.
(b) The basis for concluding that a youth exhibits self-care
potential.
(c) That the youth’s social service worker has personally
observed and determined that the living situation is safe
and that the youth has a bed and has access to cooking
and bathing facilities
(d) The availability of specific and relevant resources that
provide for suitable social, physical, educational,
vocational, and emotional needs of a youth.
(e) An evaluation of a youth's need for supervision and a
plan for providing the level of supervision determined
necessary.
(f) Proof that financial support to meet the youth’s housing,
clothing, food, and miscellaneous expenses is available.
7

Three independent living records were reviewed. Two out of
three did not have the above information documented before
placement in independent living.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional ISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
R 400.12502 Program statement.
(2) An agency shall give a copy of the program statement to a youth before
placement in independent living. The agency did not have a process for verifying that
the youth received the program statement before going into independent living.
Currently a case note is documented, but this lacks the verification needed. A
signature page should be attached for verification of the current program statement.
R 400.12327 Special Evaluation
The agency was provided technical assistance on how to write special evaluations.
This included: MIC involvement, additional findings, and repetitive information.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
Restraints in foster homes were discussed. If a foster parent is to restrain a child, the
foster parent is to be trained on a restraint module and this behavior management will
be placed in the treatment plan of the child.
VI. Analyst Concerns
There are no concerns to report.
VII. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
8

licensing period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency has completed their CAP.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MSA requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
.
10/26/20

Venus M. Decker Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
October 28, 2020
________________________________________
Linda D. Tansil Date
Area Manager
